reviewText: I got it for my Dad, who was on the carrier in the 60's.  Enjoyed it.
I purchase it as a gift for an elderly sailor who served on the carrier. It brought back good memories for him. He is a proud vet!

My father was a "plank owner" on the Shangri-La. She was the only U.S. Navy ship to be named after a fictitious place. I have never been able to find too many photos of the ship (CV-38, a Lexington-class carrier). This was more than I have ever seen. Well-produced using what was available, I would not hesitate to order another Traditions Military Video.
